Event.name: Change_of_phase
Event.definition: <def-root>In this frame a <fen>Patient</fen> undergoes a change of phase. Note that this frame contrasts with Change_of_consistency in that this frame describes a change of a <fen>Patient</fen> between different phases (i.e. solid to liquid or frozen to "unfrozen"). <ex><fex name="Patient">The water</fex> <t>froze</t>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Patient">The rock</fex> <t>solidifies</t> <fex name="Initial_state">from its molten state</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Patient">The lake</fex> <t>froze</t> <fex name="Result">solid</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Patient">The lake</fex> <t>froze</t> <fex name="Result">into ice</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Patient">The lake</fex> <t>froze</t> <fex name="Degree">to depths of 30 feet</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Patient
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Patient</fen> is the entity that undergoes a change of phase. <ex><fex name="Patient">The water</fex> <t>froze</t>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Result</fen> indicates the result of the change of phase.
<ex>The lake <t>froze</t> <fex name="Result">solid</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Initial_state
Arg.definition: <def-root>This is the original state of the <fen>Patient</fen>. <ex>The rock <t>solidified</t> <fex name="Initial_state"> from its molten state</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>Degree to which the <fen>Patient</fen> changes phase. <ex>The lake <t>froze</t> <fex name="Degree">to depths of 30 feet</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Speed
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Speed</fen> at which the change of phase occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Patient</fen> changes phase.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Circumstances</fen> at which the phase change occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Subregion
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Subregion</fen> describes which part of a larger whole is being affected.
<ex>The cloth <t>froze</t> <fex name="sub">around the edges</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: freeze.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (with reference to a liquid) turn or be turned into ice or another solid as a result of extreme cold.

lexUnit.name: vaporize.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: convert or be converted into vapour. with obj.

lexUnit.name: evaporate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: turn from liquid into vapour

lexUnit.name: solidify.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or become hard or solid

lexUnit.name: thaw.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: become liquid or soft as a result of warming up

lexUnit.name: sublime.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (with reference to a solid substance) change directly into vapour when heated, typically forming a solid deposit again on cooling.

lexUnit.name: condense.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: change from a gas or vapour to a liquid

lexUnit.name: melt.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or become liquefied by heating.

lexUnit.name: condensation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the conversion of a vapour or gas to a liquid.

lexUnit.name: evaporation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of liquid turning to gas

lexUnit.name: solidification.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of becoming more solid

lexUnit.name: sublimation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of a solid turning directly into vapor.
